meanings.definition: A group of people who behave in a disorderly or riotous manner.
meanings.sent1: The rabbler outside the stadium caused chaos.
meanings.sent2: The police had to disperse the rabbler before the situation escalated.
meanings.sent3: The rabbler at the party were having too much fun and got a bit rowdy.
meanings.sent4: The rabbler of students in the cafeteria sounded like a roaring thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The rabbler of birds in the park created a cacophony of chirps and tweets.

meanings.definition: To stir up a crowd of people to behave in a disorderly or riotous manner.
meanings.sent1: The politician tried to rabbler the crowd with his fiery speech.
meanings.sent2: The instigator managed to rabbler the peaceful protest into a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child attempted to rabbler the other kids during recess.
meanings.sent4: The rumor quickly spread through the school and rabblered the students into a frenzy.
meanings.sent5: The charismatic leader knew how to rabbler the audience into a standing ovation.
